Thermal Conductivity.Description: Thermal conductivity is inversely related to thermal insulation. Materials with low thermal conductivity are good insulators.
Metals generally have high thermal conductivity due to the presence of free electrons that can easily transfer heat.
Polymers typically have low thermal conductivity due to their molecular structure, making them good thermal insulators.
